com.iota.iri.service.snapshot.impl

Class SnapshotProviderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.service.snapshot.impl.SnapshotProviderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SnapshotProvider

    public class SnapshotProviderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements SnapshotProvider
    Implements the basic contract of the SnapshotProvider interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SnapshotProviderImpl(SnapshotConfig config)
      Creates a data provider for the two Snapshot instances that are relevant for the node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SnapshotProviderImpl

        public SnapshotProviderImpl(SnapshotConfig config)
                     throws SnapshotException
        Creates a data provider for the two Snapshot instances that are relevant for the node. It provides access to the two relevant Snapshot instances: - the initial Snapshot (the starting point of the ledger based on the last global or local Snapshot) - the latest Snapshot (the state of the ledger after applying all changes up till the latest confirmed milestone)
        Parameters:
        config - Snapshot related configuration parameters
        Throws:
        SnapshotException - if anything goes wrong while trying to read the snapshots

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialSnapshot

        public Snapshot getInitialSnapshot()
        Returns the Snapshot that reflects the start of the ledger (either the last global or a local Snapshot). This Snapshot will be modified whenever a new local Snapshot is taken.
        Specified by:
        getInitialSnapshot in interface SnapshotProvider
        Returns:
        the Snapshot that reflects the start of the ledger (either the last global or a local Snapshot)

      • getLatestSnapshot

        public Snapshot getLatestSnapshot()
        Returns the Snapshot that reflects the most recent "confirmed" state of the ledger. This Snapshot will be modified whenever a new milestone arrives and new transactions are confirmed.
        Specified by:
        getLatestSnapshot in interface SnapshotProvider
        Returns:
        the Snapshot that represents the most recent "confirmed" state of the ledger

      • writeSnapshotToDisk

        public void writeSnapshotToDisk(Snapshot snapshot,
                                java.lang.String basePath)
                         throws SnapshotException
        This method dumps the whole snapshot to the hard disk. It is used to persist the in memory state of the snapshot and allow IRI to resume from the local snapshot after restarts. Note: This method writes two files - the meta data file and the state file. The path of the corresponding file is determined by appending ".snapshot.meta" / ".snapshot.state" to the given base path.
        Specified by:
        writeSnapshotToDisk in interface SnapshotProvider
        Parameters:
        snapshot - the Snapshot that shall be persisted
        basePath - base path of the local snapshot files
        Throws:
        SnapshotException - if anything goes wrong while writing the file

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Frees the resources of the SnapshotProvider. Snapshots require quite a bit of memory and should be cleaned up when they are not required anymore. This is particularly important for unit tests, that create a separate instance of the SnapshotProvider.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface SnapshotProvider
